docs.snippet: Alex Rodriguez may have to sit out a year, but his lifelong celebrity is assured....
docs.lead_paragraph: Alex Rodriguez may have to sit out a year, but his lifelong celebrity is assured.
docs.abstract: Tyler Kepner On Baseball column holds that even though Alex Rodriguez may have to sit out a year, his lifelong celebrity is assured; notes that while Rodriguez’s passion for baseball is genuine, he also has an irresistible craving for what the game has brought him; asserts that if all plays out as expected he will play somewhere in 2015.

headline.main: Rodriguez Barred From Baseball, but Not From the Public Eye
headline.print_headline: Barred From Baseball, But Not From the Public Eye

docs.snippet: The arbitrator hearing Alex Rodriguez’s appeal of his 211-game doping suspension upheld most of the punishment on Saturday, sidelining him for 162 games, all of next season and the postseason....
docs.lead_paragraph: The arbitrator hearing Alex Rodriguez’s appeal of his 211-game doping suspension upheld most of the punishment on Saturday, sidelining him for 162 games, all of next season and the postseason.
docs.abstract: Fredric R Horowitz, arbitrator hearing Alex Rodriguez's appeal of 211-game doping suspension, upholds most of punishment sought by MLB against the New York Yankees slugger, sidelining him for 162 games; ruling suspends Rodriguez for all of 2014 season and postseason, and raises the possibility that baseball's highest-paid player will never play another game, particularly because he has been hobbled by injuries.

headline.main: Arbitrator’s Ruling Banishes the Yankees’ Alex Rodriguez for a Season
headline.print_headline: Rodriguez Out For All of 2014, Arbitrator Says

docs.snippet: The Yankees have been attempting to keep their payroll below $189 million in 2014. Alex Rodriguez’s suspension makes that possible and frees them to make a strong contract offer to Masahiro Tanaka...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Yankees have been attempting to keep their payroll below $189 million in 2014. Alex Rodriguez’s suspension makes that possible and frees them to make a strong contract offer to Masahiro Tanaka
docs.abstract: New York Yankees have been attempting to keep their payroll below $189 million in 2014; Alex Rodriguez’s suspension makes that possible and frees them to make a strong contract offer to Japanese pitcher Masahiro Tanaka

headline.main: For Yanks, Some Payroll Relief Now but Questions Down the Road

docs.snippet: The affirmation of Alex Rodriguez’s suspension for doping may leave the next move up to the Yankees....
docs.lead_paragraph: The affirmation of Alex Rodriguez’s suspension for doping may leave the next move up to the Yankees.
docs.abstract: Juliet Macur Sports of The Times column holds that the affirmation of Alex Rodriguez’s suspension for doping may leave the next move up to the New York Yankees; asserts that they should buy out the remainder of Rodriguez’s contract and say goodbye, for the good of the team, the fans and baseball.
